H0.text: Weaker storms, causing less shoreline erosion, are most likely a result of climate change.

H1.text: Shorter days, causing longer hibernation periods, would most likely be a result of climate change.

H2.text: Shrinking glaciers, causing sea levels to rise, is the situation most likely to result from climate change.

H3.text: Increased radioactivity, which causes damage to cells, is the situation most likely to result from climate change.

A4.text: Amplified warming in the Arctic has contributed to thawing permafrost, retreat of glaciers and sea ice decline.

A5.text: Higher temperatures are also causing more intense storms, droughts, and other weather extremes.
